data.question: What is the main product formed when acetone reacts with nitric oxide in the presence of sodium ethoxide at room temperature?
data.answer: Sodium methane-1,1-bis(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate), CH2(N2O2Na)2, 1.

data.question: What product results from the reaction of nitric oxide with 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one in the presence of NaOH and KOH?
data.answer: Sodium and potassium salts of 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one-1,1,1-tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate), 6 and 7 respectively.

data.question: What is the outcome of the reaction between nitric oxide and acetone using potassium hydroxide as the base?
data.answer: A mixture of products containing CH2(N2O2K)2, 3, and CH(N2O2K)3, 4, in 6% and 36% yield, respectively.

data.question: What is the major product when acetone reacts with nitric oxide in the presence of 4 equivalents of NaOH?
data.answer: Methanetris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate), 2, as the major product along with 1 (∼25%) and small amounts of CH(N2O2Na)2CO2Na (<1%).

data.question: What is the effect of using lithium hydroxide in the reaction of nitric oxide with acetone?
data.answer: It does not yield the lithium salt, CH(N2O2Li)3, but instead yields CH2(N2O2Li)2, 5, as the sole N2O2- containing product.

data.question: What is the yield of the ammonium salt isolated from the reaction of the silver salt of methanetris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) with ammonium iodide?
data.answer: 59% yield.

data.question: What is the role of nitric oxide in the reaction with acetone and sodium ethoxide?
data.answer: Nitric oxide reacts to form sodium methanebis(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) and sodium acetate.

data.question: How does the product distribution change when potassium hydroxide is used instead of sodium hydroxide in the reaction with acetone and nitric oxide?
data.answer: Potassium hydroxide leads to the formation of potassium salts of methane-1,1-bis(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) and methanetris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate).

data.question: Why does lithium hydroxide result in the formation of lithium methanebis(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) exclusively?
data.answer: Lithium hydroxide's reaction with nitric oxide and acetone does not lead to the trisubstituted product due to its reactivity.

data.question: What determines the product formed in the reaction of nitric oxide with acetone or 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one?
data.answer: The stoichiometry of substrate to base, the temperature, and the time of the transformation determine the products formed.

data.question: Why are differentially hydrated forms of potassium methanetris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction?
data.answer: To understand the structural characteristics and stability of the hydrated forms.

data.question: What is the significance of the observed UV−vis spectra changes for the salts of [CH(N2O2)3]3- in water?
data.answer: The changes in the UV−vis spectra indicate decomposition of the compounds in aqueous media.

data.question: Is the formation of tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) products dependent on the nature of the base employed?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the reaction of nitric oxide with acetone always result in the formation of the trisubstituted product?
data.answer: False

data.question: Are the products of the reaction between nitric oxide and acetone characterized by NMR and IR spectroscopy only?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the differential reactivity of nitric oxide with acetone and 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one attributed solely to the base used?
data.answer: False

data.question: Can the tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) substituted acetone react further with nitric oxide to form CH(N2O2Na)2CO2Na?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the formation of CH(N2O2Na)2CO2Na consistent with the proposed mechanism for the reaction of acetone with nitric oxide?
data.answer: True

data.question: Do the reactions of nitric oxide with sulfite in aqueous media yield N2O2- group-containing products?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the formation of various products in the reactions of nitric oxide with acetone or 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one solely dependent on the nature of the ketone?
data.answer: False
